before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"447kc","text":"Always wear proper Personal Protective Equipment and work in a fume hood when working with dichloromethane or PCBs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dtifl","text":"Polymeric implants are a drug delivery system that can be grafted under the skin to allow for the continuous release of a particular substance or compound, such as polychlorinated biphenyls (PCBs) or their derivatives. In this protocol, we describe the preparation of polymeric polycaprolactone implants loaded with a hydroxylated polychlorinated biphenyl (PCB) metabolite or a related compound (i.e., biphenyl-4-ol). These implants can be grafted subcutaneously in rats to release the test compound continuously. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences
National Institute of Environmental Health Sciences

(P-80, Average Mn 80000, Sigma 440744-250G, Lot# MKCL0177)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8srq4","text":"Pluronic (F-127, Sigma P2443-250G, Lot# BCCC2327)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpj4g","text":"Dichloromethane, Pesticide grade (Fisher, D142-4)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq2vl","text":"Accessories","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86m93","text":"Silastic (silicone) tubing (I.D. 0.104 inch x O.D. 0.192 inch, VWR International, 62999-868 )","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cibmn","text":"Disposable plastic syringe (5 mL)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9er7","text":"Oil bath","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mmmq","text":"Hot plate, with thermometer (IKA RCT basic hotplate with IKA ETS-D5 thermometer)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cs2n","text":"1 125 mL Beaker","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qh6h","text":"Glass rod","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sg99","text":"Vacuum oven (Napco, model Shen, J. Jeyabalan, X. Xin, H. J. Lehmler, G. Ludewig, L. W. Robertson and R. C. C., S. S. Bansal, F. Aqil, J. Jeyabalan, P. Cao, H. Kausar, G. K. Russell, R. Munagala, S. Ravoori and M. V. status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7i1lp","text":"Working in a hood, add 7 g of P-80 and 0.7 g of F127 in 20 mL of dichloromethane in a 125 mL glass beaker.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68d2o","text":"Add the test compound (i.e., biphenyl-4-ol or a hydroxylated PCB metabolite) to the P-80/F127 mixture in dichloromethane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77hni","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"civu7","text":"Note: The amount of the test compound can be based on the percent of the total weight of the polymer (e.g., 1%, 5%, or 10% of the total weight, including the test compound, or 0.08, 0.41, or 0.86 g of the test compound, respectively). Alternatively, proceed directly to Step 3 to prepare the control implants with 0 % of the test compound.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bhko8","text":"Place the beaker in an oil bath at 70 °C to evaporate the solvent by stirring occasionally. Stirring will help the solvent evaporate faster and more evenly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9usoc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gepf","text":"Note: An oil bath is used to prevent water condensation from getting into the solution. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mpt1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48avh","text":"The polymer will return to its original whitish color (Picture 1) and should still be pliable; this will take about 20-30 min in the oil bath, depending on the amount of solvent added.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"domu9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuni5","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"66AFDFE0F70611ED9603332D1D0A8BAE","height":311,"id":374773,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"9er8c\",\"text\":\"Picture 1: Appearance of the polymer mixture before extrusion.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Image of polymer before extrusion.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9z47me.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9x47me.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9y47me.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9w47me.webp","width":494}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mt8o","text":"Load the pliable polymer mixture with the desired amount of the test compound (or not test compound for the control implants) into a 5 mL disposable plastic syringe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"df2co","text":"Attach silicone tubing with the desired internal diameter to the syringe. The diameter of the silicone tubing will determine the final diameter of the implants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eupar","text":"Force the polymer mixture into the silicone tubing until approximately 7 to 8 cm of the tubing is evenly filled with the polymer mixture. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o90o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95d0f","text":"Note: The polymer mixture is very viscous, so there will be resistance when extruding into silicone tubing. Place the syringe back in the oven as necessary. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"59g5i","text":"Let the extruded polymer mixture set for 24 h at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eg2q2","text":"Once the polymer has hardened, remove the mold by making a small incision along the silicone tubing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"318s5","text":"Let molded polymer sit out overnight in a fume hood to remove any residual dichloromethane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3cl0h","text":"Store implants in labeled amber glass vials at -80°C until use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3suhp","text":"Allow about 45 minutes to dissolve the polymer, resulting in a clear solution (Figure 1). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5ho4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s09o","text":"Note: Add more dichloromethane if the solvent no longer covers the polymer pellets. The polymer dissolves faster if it forms an even layer in the beaker. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bih9f","text":"Cover the solution to prevent the dichloromethane from evaporation ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8deh8","text":"After 45 minutes, uncover and gently stir the polymer solution with a glass stir rod until the mixture is smooth and of a viscous consistency (this will be different depending on the amount of solvent added).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2d0nn","text":"Place the syringe with the attached silicone tubing in an oven at 70°C for several minutes until the solution is clear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"574te","text":"Replace the silicone tubing once the polymer mixture in the tubing reaches between 7 and 8 cm. Repeat this step until the syringe is empty.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"579j9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"60cqt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F3255D10F70611ED9603332D1D0A8BAE","height":248,"id":374777,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"b5cpb\",\"text\":\"Picture 2: Polymer after extrusion.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Image of the extruded polymer.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9547me.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9347me.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9447me.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9247me.webp","width":516}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"152fn","text":"Place the implants in a vacuum oven for 2 h to remove residual dichloromethane (PiPiccture 3).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62u1k","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"402FA750F70711ED9603332D1D0A8BAE","height":345,"id":374781,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"4o4pr\",\"text\":\"Picture 3: Final polymeric implants.\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Image of final polymeric implants.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9947me.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9747me.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9847me.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mp9647me.webp","width":343}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ap8t8","text":"Weigh and measure each implant individually (Figure 3). The average diameter of implant is 2.3 ± 0.1 mm ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Preparation of Polymeric Implants for the Sustained Release of Polychlorinated Biphenyls (PCBs) and Their Derivatives

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"3c3bs","text":"Dichloromethane (DCM) : Advice on safe handling Work under hood. Do not inhale substance/mixture. Avoid generation of vapours/aerosols. Hygiene measures Immediately change contaminated clothing. Apply preventive skin protection. Wash hands and face after working with substance. Do not breathe vapors, aerosols. Avoid substance contact. Ensure adequate ventilation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cpb5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v718","text":"Polychlorinated biphenyl (PCB): May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure.Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects. Do not breathe dust/fume/gas/mist/vapours/spray. Avoid release to the environment. This statement does not apply where this is the intended use. Get medical advice/attention if you feel unwell. Collect spillage. Dispose of contents/container in accordance with relevant regulations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
